website_summaries.verdict: Lots of useful tips along with tested and tasty recipes to help you follow the Mediterranean Diet.
pros: Mediterranean diet is low in red meat and sugar, high in nuts, fruit, and seafood
This book has lots of tested and tasty recipes, that are not generally as time consuming as some other cookbooks
Divided into useful sections to help you implement the Mediterranean food pyramid
Offers a lot of details on specific ingredients and how they can add to your overall diet
cons: This is not a quick start-lose weight program, but rather a whole life healthier way of eating

website_summaries.verdict: America’s Test Kitchen is a trusted name for many consumers. Tips and info make it more than just a cookbook.
pros: This beautiful, easy-to-use cookbook encompasses some of the most delicious and healthy meals from all around the Mediterranean area, including recipes from areas of southern Europe and northern Africa
cons: Some users report ingredients are hard to find, or are quite expensive

customer_reviews.title: Tastes great, lost weight!
customer_reviews.text: I have several ATK cookbooks, but this is now our go-to cookbook. It's helped us shift our eating habits away from meat, potatoes and pasta - although all three are included here - to healthier options. I've lost 11 pounds in a month of eating dinners from this cookbook and following their Mediterranean food pyramid.
customer_reviews.author: M. Warren

customer_reviews.title: Healthy and delicious!
customer_reviews.text: Excelent book! Just what I was looking for, hundreds of healthy and delicious recipes with good descriptions and a guide to pick up and store ingredients, so 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: HM

customer_reviews.title: Great all around cookbook, even for gluten free people
customer_reviews.text: I am demanding on cookbooks. I like flavor, I like frugality, and I need my meals to be gluten free. These recipes are very flavorful and the reviews on the best brands for items like sardines and anchovies are very helpful. Some of the meals, especially the bean section, are economical. The others are worth the price. Finally, many recipes are gluten free as written, and many of the others can easily be adjusted. I feel better when I eat in this genre. Thank you, ATK!
customer_reviews.author: Lawyer Chic

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: While the recipes are wonderful, easy to follow directions and outstanding photos, the quality of the book is terrible. I use the book 2 to 3 times per week. I use a cookbook stand and the pages are falling out. I contacted the America's Test Kitchen and they said tough luck since I bought the book through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: J. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality binding for this cookbook!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: the recipes in this book are good. however, the binding quality of the book is TERRIBLE. each page is starting to come loose after a couple months of normal use. I emailed the editor / publisher regarding the problem and never received a response. apparently, taking care of the customer and product quality are not a priority.....
customer_reviews.author: ddevore99

customer_reviews.title: Not what I hoped for, extremely complicated & difficult
customer_reviews.text: Due to health reasons, with a doctor's advice to switch to a healthier (e.g. Mediterranean) diet, and based on the customer reviews, I purchased this book. MISTAKE! The description does not say that the recipes are complicated. As other reviewers noted (and I found the reviews MUCH too late), the time needed for prep for most recipes is ridiculous, the equipment required isn't something most "normal" kitchens have, nor are many of the ingredients readily or easily available, especially at a reasonable price for something where you may only use 1/4 teaspoon... Will be returning for refund.
customer_reviews.author: DLM

customer_reviews.title: Get This!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this cookbook. The recipes are well balanced in flavor and the book is full of variety. It gives so many explanations. This is my new kitchen-bible.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: If you live in the Midwest beware
customer_reviews.text: I have many of the America's Test Kitchen, Cook's Country & Cook's Illustrated cookbooks. I also subscribe to their magazines and web pages. This is the first book that I have been disappointed in. Many recipes call for ingredients that are not available in Midwest grocery stores. I will have to order these ingredients and then most likely only use a few times. I'm thinking of returning the book.
customer_reviews.author: MI Kate

customer_reviews.title: Not what I’d hoped for
customer_reviews.text: Not what I’d hoped or expected. Way too many substitutions and shortcuts that make the dishes Americanized. I was surprised to see, for the first time in any cookbook I’ve come across, Moroccan tagine recipes with wine as an ingredient, considering it’s a Muslim country. I may refer to the book here and there but it makes me wonder about this collection’s overall inauthenticity.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Helms

customer_reviews.title: I was hoping for something that would help me on ...
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for something that would help me on the Mediterranean diet my doctor wants me to follow. Too much fatty meat, not enough of what I was hoping for meal plan wise. I think I will hit a book store where I can look before I buy.
customer_reviews.author: Maryann Whitten

customer_reviews.title: Too Fancy
customer_reviews.text: This book is full of interesting recipes, but most of them seem like recipes that would be used at a fancy Mediterranean restaurant, not in the kitchens of average Americans trying to eat healthier. I was hoping for several easy fish and vegetable recipes, but instead I have recipes that call for things I have never even bought at the grocery store before. Stuffed dates, calamari, mussels, saffron...the list goes on. I do love to cook, but 80% of these recipes just aren't very practical or family friendly. If you have kids, you don't want this book!
customer_reviews.author: LACG

customer_reviews.title: Print Size
customer_reviews.text: Looked forward to receiving this book, however, the print is just too small for me (even with my glasses). Sorry!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra J Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: The only Mediterranean cookbook you'll need.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book last year. I hate cooking and only cook about 1X a week. I've liked every recipe that I've tried out of it. It also has great cooking tips for people like me who hate cooking and don't know how long to grill vegetables, etc. The book doesn't assume that you know what you're doing, it give you tips and stuff. There are nice pictures and variations for almost every recipe. If you are looking for ANY type of Mediterranean cookbook, then this book is a MUST for you.
customer_reviews.author: amy allen

customer_reviews.title: I'm still reading this cook book, and while there ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm still reading this cook book, and while there is a lot of information in it, some of the recipe's are just not practical for the every day cook, who does not have access to many of the herbs and spices the recipe's require. I was looking something more for the every day cook.
customer_reviews.author: Laura M. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: I lost 6 ponds in one month
customer_reviews.text: I was diagnosed prediabetic. I heard mediatarrinean foos is healthy and helps to spike blood sugar, so I got this book. I have serial receipe books and usually they are ok but this book!!!!! Amazing!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Good if you are opening a restaurant
customer_reviews.text: Impractical recipes for everyday cooking. Beautiful layout and there are some amazing sounding recipes though.
customer_reviews.author: J. Be

customer_reviews.title: No Prep Time
customer_reviews.text: Great recipes. So far everyone has loved the meals I have cooked using this book. One thing that would be helpful is to know with anticipation how long it's going to take to make the meal, prep time should be included for each. The recipes I have tried to date have taken at least 2 hours another up to 4 hours. Knowing what kitchen gadgets, utensils and type of pot or skillet can also be helpful. I will continue to try the recipes, I will however do it on a day that I have plenty of time this book is not for weeknights if you have a full time job.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Hansborough

customer_reviews.title: Really Fullproof reciepes
customer_reviews.text: Have made over 30 recipes from this book. It is perfect and I bought two more as gifts. Some note that it takes a while to make any of the recipes. True, but once you do it, it goes faster the next time. Its just first recipe slowness that most experience. All recipes have been incredibly tasty! You can not go wrong with this book!
customer_reviews.author: Kris Crassweller

customer_reviews.title: Overwelming
customer_reviews.text: The pictures look great but the recipes are a wall of text. Most of them seem really hard and time consuming to make. I need something easier I think. Also the binding broke right away.
customer_reviews.author: mimc

customer_reviews.title: Great Recipes:
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this book for a birthday gift. The gift was for a friend who had open heart surgery, and was looking to change his diet. I asked his wife what we could buy him, and she told me he liked to cook. I knew this was the book. Easy recipes, with beautiful pictures, so you could see the finished product. I saw them yesterday, and they both thanked me. Gary loved the book and is using it almost everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes, use this book weekly!
customer_reviews.text: I had found this cookbook at my library, and after having it for two weeks, I decided it was worth the buy! I have tried at least 8 recipe is from this cookbook, and have not been disappointed yet. Not only are the recipes good, but the book is very informative, with additional information on how to choose produce, tips on preparing produce easier, etc. I feel like cooks of all levels could benefit from this book!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not my cup of tea
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to eat healthier this year so thought I'd try Mediterranean diet. I was looking for a more simple approach. I did not see any recipes that I would want to eat or try. I gave the book to my son as he has been vegan, vegetarian, on paleo and keto at different times in his life. Hopefully he will try some of the recipes as he enjoys this type of cooking. Too many ingredients for me.
customer_reviews.author: matt's mom

customer_reviews.title: Why it had a high rating ?
customer_reviews.text: I ordered it because I thought he Mediterranean diet was good for your heart. Not what I thought it would be. It will go in my trash.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Too much info per page
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to read due to small font and too much info per page. Recipes might have been good, but too hard to read and knew I couldn't read them while preparing. I returned this cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle

customer_reviews.title: Good recipes...so far.
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid cookbook. I’ve only tried one recipe so far, it turned out delicious. All the recipes look like they been well researched, tried and true type. I love the helpful background tips like types of grains and rice. Two faults would be larger font for my old eyes and more pictures but I’m a visual person. Other than that this is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: P. M.

customer_reviews.title: Useful for Special Occasions.
customer_reviews.text: The title is an exaggeration. A more fitting title would be: "The Guide to Expensive, Complex Mediterranean Style Cooking". My wife (a great, experienced cook, and caterer with shelves of cookbooks) says most of the recipies would require too long to prepare to be practicle and are more costly than middle income families could frequently afford. The book does contain some delicious looking recipes for special occasions but shouldn't be considered as a guide to practical daily Mediterranean style cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Valiant Son

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and thank you
customer_reviews.text: I made my first recipe from this book and wow!!! This book far surpasses anything you will find on the internet or just about anywhere else because of it’s concise explanations and detailed photographs. There’s even a separate section for how to make sauces. The recipe I just made was for Shellfish Soup with Leeks and turmeric. I have never made anything like this before but gained confidence after reading the small paragraphs of background information and then followed the easy, step-by-step instructions. If you’re serious about cooking this style of food, please buy this book. I promise you won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: modus77

customer_reviews.title: Not very good if you live in Utah and can't get most ingredients.
customer_reviews.text: I was kind of disappointed. For some reason I thought it was connected to the Mediterranean diet, Most of the dishes have ingredients that are not readily available here in Utah, except at specialty stores and most are expensive. Some I've never heard of before. I don't know what I was thinking when I ordered it.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Foster

customer_reviews.title: I would like to return it but waited too long
customer_reviews.text: It is too complicated and requires ingredients that are not readily available. I would like to return it but waited too long.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: One of Cooks Illustrated best!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite CI cookbook so far and I have owned some 30 of them over the years. Many of the CI cookbooks can be filled with repeats from other books but I did not find this to be true of this book. I am making seafood risotto tonight and know it will be scrumptious. Have tried 10 recipes so far and all were excellent. I love to grill, love vegetables, grains and pasta, and this book will keep me busy for some time. I have already bought 4 as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: lrskfalls

customer_reviews.title: My heart is pleased!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this book!! I recently had a heart attack and was told to go on a Mediterranean diet. I felt like there was no way I could change all of my eating habits and maintain my sanity. And never thought I would think a heart healthy lifestyle would be so tasty! I have been so pleased and feel so good about my eating now that I purchased one for my dad for father's day. It is for him and mom both since he does most of the cooking! :)
customer_reviews.author: Jeaknie

customer_reviews.title: A Must-Have
customer_reviews.text: This cookbook is outstanding. I have made probably 15 recipes from it now, and they have all been incredible. The positive reviews are for real. This book is worth every penny and will be your new favorite. I don't usually cook from recipes, but I was looking for a cookbook to expand my knowledge of flavors and cooking techniques. This book was exactly what I was looking for. While this book is not sold as a healthy cook book, there are many vegetarian/pescatarian and non-gluten options. I've been having so much fun and grateful that I live near stores that provide the fresh ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Jewel

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: This cookbook was not what I was looking for. The description makes it sound like it will provide guidance and meal plans in order to follow the Mediterranean-based *weight-loss* diet, but that is not what this is. This is simply a very general and large compendium of vaguely Mediterranean recipes - and not a terribly authentic one, at that (and I'm Italian and Greek, so...). I already have much better cookbooks for this type of food. I feel like this is miscategorized.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Delicious recipes and lots of bonus content
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this cookbook. Not only are the recipes great, but there is also ample bonus content like recommended brands of ingredients to bring out the best in the recipes. It is informative and engaging. It's the kind of cookbook you can curl up with and page though, dreaming up when you will make the recipes! My only regret is that I didn't buy the one with the spiral binding. This is my go to Mediterranean cookbook...so far!
customer_reviews.author: J. AdamTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes, but not something I could stick to ...
customer_reviews.text: Great recipes, but not something I could stick to daily. I know the mediterranean diet is the ideal way to eat, but I can't imagine true mediterranean food everyday. Some of the ingredients are hard to find in my grocery store (probably need to hit up a specialty store, coop, or whole foods). Unfortunately, these ingredients are needed for the flavor and it's not easily substitutable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good.
customer_reviews.text: I was raised on the mediterranean way of eating. Life got busy and I got Lazy. So, when I decided to return to the diet I grew up on I thought I would buy a good cookbook to take me back to my roots. This book is good. I would say that it might be a good starting point for those completely unfamiliar with this way of eating. For me personally, it may not have been the best choice but I would still give it an all star rating .
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: Comprehensive guide to GOURMET and HEALTHY Mediterranean cooking
customer_reviews.text: This is a huge cookbook! I love that this book is focused on healthy recipes, but also developed by America's Test Kitchen so everything is gourmet. Many of the recipes fall into the weeknight dinner category, which is helpful because of the short prep time. Everything I've made from this cookbook has been true to the Mediterranean diet, and delicious. I love the menu plans as well!
customer_reviews.author: Sasha Lund

customer_reviews.title: Great cookbook, not so great book
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good cookbook. I have lost 25 pounds simply from changing what I eat and I use this cookbook to develop my daily menus. I can find most all ingredients in my small SE Idaho town. What makes it even better is that many of the recipes are gluten free, a benefit since my grandson has Celiac disease and is gluten intolerant. What kept my rating at 4 stars is the glue in the cookbook let loose after about 8 months and all the pages are now loose. But I still use the cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: B. Warren

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic book, delicious recipes
customer_reviews.text: We love this cook book! Colorful, easy to follow instructions, love the "why this recipe works" piece for each recipe. Every recipe we have tried so far has been amazing - yes, the recipes take a bit more time to put together, but totally worth it! Highly recommend (and bonus, my husband and I have both lost weight using this book!)
customer_reviews.author: Amy Sylvester

customer_reviews.title: OK if you want to spend hours in the kitching and grocery store.
customer_reviews.text: Lovely photos but so many steps and ingredient to each recipe. Who has time for that? I returned it and got the "30 minute Mediterranean Cookbook." It is reasonable and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: SimplifyHHI

customer_reviews.title: America's Test Kitchen Teaches Well
customer_reviews.text: I haven't made a bad dish from this cookbook. The recipes range in difficulty but the FAST ones are labeled in red. Every recipe starts with WHY THIS RECIPE WORKS so you understand what each step contributes to the final effect. We also learn exactly where the food is native. There are 120 or so pages of vegetarian dishes: beans, chickpeas, couscous, pasta etc, enough to keep vegetarians happy for many a meal. Most recipes have a color picture and some have as many as four. Something like lentils gets 5 pictures to show each kind. Like I said, it teaches well.
customer_reviews.author: Mimjo

customer_reviews.title: Delicious recipes, photos, educational details
customer_reviews.text: We've tried about 8 recipes (mains + salads_ and all but one have been great so far. (The one came out a little bland, but I think it was our fault for being too conservative with the anchovies). I like the "Why this recipe works" explanation provided for each recipe as well as the helpful information about buying ingredients, techniques, etc. There are lots of pictures to let you see what many of the dishes look like and it's printed on good quality paper. Unfortunately many of the recipes are a bit too involved for us to make on weeknights, so we've had to limit to making these on weekends and enjoying leftovers during the week. Overall a good cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: rbothun

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes for the Mediterranean lifestyle
customer_reviews.text: Excellent recipes, with many variations for different diet desires (vegan, etc). I am a fan of America's test Kitchen, but frankly I was shocked that there is NO NUTRITIONAL INFORMATION FOR ANY OF THE RECIPES! One reason I bought this book is that I like these foods, but also the health benefits. It is importanty to me to know the nutritional content, because it is very easy to eat many things in this book and really rack up the calorie count if you don't know what a serving size is, and how many calories, fat, sodium, carbs and protein are in each serving. I
customer_reviews.author: Nick J

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Book But........
customer_reviews.text: The book is lovely. Nice paper, beautiful color pictures. Everything looks so scrumptious. Explanations of different kinds of ingredients and how to choose good ingredients. The only problem is finding a lot of unobtainable ingredients which is not the authors fault. I will keep the book, there are 500 recipes and I'm hopeful there are quite a few that I can make.
customer_reviews.author: Sue B.

customer_reviews.title: We use this cookbook every week!
customer_reviews.text: We love this cookbook! It has so many great healthy recipes that are easy to incorporate into your normal meal plan schedule. The detailed instructions are very helpful and you rarely need anything more complicated than a pot with a lid. We’ve been able to incorporate more whole grains, vegetables, and legumes into our diet with this cookbook. Every recipe we’ve tried has been a smash hit! Pictured is the Shakshuka (which we served over plain barley with sourdough toast) and grilled shrimp with Egyptian Salad.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Reed

customer_reviews.title: Stop. Buy it. Right now.
customer_reviews.text: This book has absolutely revolutionized the way my family eats. We cook one of these recipes at least two, sometimes five nights a week. They're practically foolproof and so unbelievably delicious. In three weeks I've lost six pounds (disclaimer: I also run and workout six days a week) but I feel absolutely stuffed every meal and I'm not eating anything I don't like. Even if you aren't trying to lose weight this book is chock full of amazing food. You will not regret buying this. Just do it already.
customer_reviews.author: Josh B.

customer_reviews.title: If this is what mediterranean foods really taste like, then I have never tasted mediterranean foods before
customer_reviews.text: Faithfully following the recipes has opened my world to an entirely new set of flavors. If this is what mediterranean foods really taste like, then I have never tasted mediterranean foods before, in thirty years of visiting restaurants. The food is delicious, and branches far beyond the "meat and potatoes" style of cooking, where any vegetable or bean is always a boring side dish. I would put this book next to my ATK Vegetarian Cookbook, for teaching the user to cook hearty main dishes that spotlight fruits & vegetables.
customer_reviews.author: P. Shyvers

customer_reviews.title: Good baseline but complete recipes are for pros, and or afficianados
customer_reviews.text: This has many good ideas in it. I've used it quite a bit but I do things a little simpler than most recipes. I'd love to eat what their exact recipes call for but don't have the time to make it. But base ideas have helped quite a bit as I get into the diet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for you average pantry
customer_reviews.text: I would have liked to give this cookbook a higher rating because the few recipes I have been able to make are very good. But the complaint I have with it is that several of the recipes call for ingredients that are not readily obtainable, at least in my urban locality - for example octopus, monkfish, and quail. The same holds true for the ingredients, for example, za’atar. I would like a GOOD Mediterranean cookbook for the average cook. Is there a Mediterranean Julia Child out there somewhere?
customer_reviews.author: Nina Dougherty

customer_reviews.title: A Compendium of Options
customer_reviews.text: One of the best cook books I have ever purchased. An enormous spectrum of ingredient options complete with understandable steps and directions to construct both complimentary flavors as well as whole meals. A completely comprehensive guide to the Mediterranean cuisine. We have used this reference as a guide for two straight months and have not yet repeated a recipe while finding many many to be favorites.
customer_reviews.author: Randall W. Graves

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes.
customer_reviews.text: Good cookbook. If you like to spend a lot of time in the kitchen. My doctor recommended it. But, I don't do much cooking these days. After 52 years of cooking, I'd rather just throw together a salad and top it off with some grilled chicken. It does have a lot of great information in it. I ended up returning it because I knew that I wouldn't be happy about spending a lot of time prepping for one.
customer_reviews.author: mcpopp

customer_reviews.title: Great organization and information!
customer_reviews.text: This comprehensive book has a wide variety of recipes, very clear instructions, and lots of helpful information that makes menu planning easy (like indications of time required and complexity of meal, and appropriateness for those with dietary restrictions). It is also spiral bound so it's easy to open to the recipe you're following. I made two of the recipes today and they turned out beautifully!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: COMPLICATED
customer_reviews.text: I found the book overwhelming and complicated with 10+ ingredients for many of the recipes. Each recipe gives the total servings, but it does not identify what a single serving is. The nutrition for each recipe is packed in the back of the book in rows, but again does not tell you what a serving size is. I opted for a couple of other Mediterranean cookbooks that supply simpler recipes.
customer_reviews.author: C L Frost

customer_reviews.title: YES YES YES YES get this
customer_reviews.text: WOW WOW WOW I delayed buying bci have so many cookbooks. (I'm a bit of a book hoarder). So to temper my purchases I hold off buying until I find myself back there again. This is TOTALLY worth it. I love all ATK content. So high quality and informative. This book is unmatched. The recipes are fantastically broad. Including all Mediterranean regions. The recipes from just browsing seem all levels but the taste experience will be splendid in each. I already have my first recipe picked out: Chili marinated Calamari w Oranges. Omg yes.
customer_reviews.author: T. Villarreal

customer_reviews.title: So many great recipes!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to try and help lower my gfs cholesterol since the Mediterranean diet is one of the only ‘fad’ diets that’s proven slightly beneficial for cardiovascular health. There’s tons of amazing recipes that have had us cooking unique dishes all year long (and repetitively cooked many favorites)
customer_reviews.author: JM Amazonia

customer_reviews.title: Mediterranean Diet Cookbook so heart friendly.
customer_reviews.text: My husband had heart surgery and cardiologist recommended a Mediterranean Diet.This had high reviews on the Dr. Oz show so I ordered it. I have used many recipes and gained knowledge of the Mediterranean Diet and reasons why this is so healthy for our hearts.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen DeNiel

customer_reviews.title: Such a great cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I love cooking, and understand that the Mediterranean diet is the best way to eat. So, knowing that test-kitchen recipes are the way to go, I purchased this. I am so happy that I did. The recipes are not hard, but can be involved, and nothing that something that a person who is comfortable in a kitchen can't handle. If you are looking for a good Mediterranean cookbook, complete with descriptions of the "why" a recipe works (so that you can become a better cook on your own) this is the book for you. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Dining in is now better than going out
customer_reviews.text: When my doctor recommended that I follow the Mediterranean diet to help me lose weight, I came home and ordered this cookbook. The recipes are easy to follow, provide guidance and helpful tips. I have learned how to braise chicken, make perfect salad dressings and more. My family and friends request that I make the Kale with roasted sweet potatoes and pecan salad whenever we get together.
customer_reviews.author: AHarris

customer_reviews.title: One of ATK's Best!
customer_reviews.text: I have a rather large cookbook collection (in addition to the majority of ATK's books) and this is definitely in my top 10. The recipes are very fresh and easy to throw together. Whenever I'm in a slump of not knowing what to cook for dinner, or needing to eat a little "lighter" this is my go-to text. In typical ATK fashion, the book is well thought out, stuffed full of recipes (almost overwhelming) and bursting with advice/tips/tricks. Your recipes are never fail and the concepts are great! 10/10 I recommend this book and have gifted it to quite a few more people!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Experienced chefs made this book
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say enough about how perfect this cookbook is from recipes to buying food. Every recipe begins with a section called why this recipe works. The cooking prep tips throughout are great for novice and experienced chefs. It includes recipes from 21 countries.
customer_reviews.author: CFlittlerock,ar

customer_reviews.title: Better for advanced cooks.
customer_reviews.text: If your a novice I would not recommend this book. My husband who is a trained chef had to help me over and over again. This would be more along the lines of I have extra time on the weekends to make these meals.
customer_reviews.author: NEAL WARTH

customer_reviews.title: Great Cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: I have not tried a single recipe that I did not like. I have to admit that I skipped some as I did not like all the ingredients. I use this daily, and have discovered a new and healthier way to eat! I would definitely recommend this cookbood to anyone who likes to cook and try new recipes. Having the nutritional breakdown of each recipe was a great added bonus as I am trying to eat healthier.
customer_reviews.author: Star

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Looking Recipes
customer_reviews.text: I have not cooked from this book yet but a lot of my friends have it and they highly recommend it. I went though it yesterday and all of the recipes (plenty of photos, which i like in a cookbook) look amazing. They have step-by-step instructions for certain things too. I mean, it is a MUST buy! Love it and can't wait to start using some of the recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So many delicious recipes!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, there is so much information in this cookbook. I like the detailed recipes and the photos. There are not as many vegetarian meals as I would like, but several good options. The ratatouille, vegetarian paella, and orzo and eggplant casserole are standouts. Looking forward to trying more of the recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Easy to find ingredients
customer_reviews.text: My family absolutely loves this cookbook! The recipes are easy to follow, the layout is the perfect balance of information and pictures, and bets of all, the ingredients are easy to find where we live. Everything we've tried so far (about 40 recipes) has been delicious. The only thing we haven't enjoyed was a cucumber soup that is served chilled, but I think that was because of a preference for hot soups. I'd definitely recommend this cookbook to anyone wanting to enjoy the health benefits of mediterranean food.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer R.

customer_reviews.title: Not what I thought.......
customer_reviews.text: Always love cookbooks from Americas Test Kitchen however in this book had complex recipes and ingredients that I would not use, have on hand or may be hard to find. This is just my opinion, book returned. Note: as always the pictures and instructions on how to perform tasks are outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: Best cookbook ever!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had had a book like this when I was a new cook--so many details about the food, the recipes, and preparation tips. Look for nutritional values in the back of the book--all listed by recipe name. This complements my new interest in Mediterranean cooking in a major way--very informative, with great recipes. Maybe I'll just dump the old cookbooks with unhealthy recipes!
customer_reviews.author: Aloosha

customer_reviews.title: Best Mediterranean cookbook out there!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, thorough cookbook. I've already made 10 or so recipes and they've all been super tasty. The chicken with walnut sauce is seriously one of the best dishes I've ever eaten. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Burton

customer_reviews.title: It is an exciting cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: I have never been more pleased with a cookbook before, and this one is way pleasing. I have made fifteen recipes so far and all have been most delicious! Love the spices and the way things are put together and how they show substitutions in case an ingredient is unavailable. This cookbook is laid out nicely with lots of pictures and information. I would highly recommend this cookbook for anyone interested in cooking Mediterranean. It exceeds all my expectations!!
customer_reviews.author: L. Ahearn

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: Great so far... great detail on how and why for each recipe. There's also a list in the back that tells you the calories for each recipe. Made a fish soup as our first dinner and it was fairly easy to make and everyone loved it. Bean soup tomorrow night....wish me luck.
customer_reviews.author: E. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Everything you'll need for Mediterranean living!
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying to make the leap to Mediterranean but I felt I had a long way to go. This book helped me realize I wasnt that far off! It gives a variety of recipes and staples of Mediterranean cuisine but also offers excellent advice and tips along the way. I would reccomend this to anyone looking for an entry to this lifestyle change. It isn't a short read, its hefty to be honest, but it reads well and isn't over your head.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Goblin

customer_reviews.title: Teaches concepts
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book that teaches the concepts of Mediterranean cooking, rather than simply providing recipes. The food we have made from it has all been excellent, and it is expanding our knowledge of cooking. While it has a more limited scope, it reminds me of How To Cook Everything, which is the only other cookbook that has seen much use in our house. The real beauty of books like this is that with time you no longer need them and will be making your own recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Goat

customer_reviews.title: Love this cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful cookbook. I love the buying tips for different products and the preparation details. I have only tried two of the recipes so far, both were easy to follow and turned out delicious. The orzo with shrimp, feta and lemon will definitely be in our meal rotation, so good! There are so many recipes in this book, I am looking forward to trying more.
customer_reviews.author: CaroleS

customer_reviews.title: Conflicted
customer_reviews.text: There are a large number of recipes in this book and so far all have turned out deliciously. However, I wish there were pics of each one prepared, and the ones I've tried require way too much time for me on a normal day.
customer_reviews.author: CLR

customer_reviews.title: Must buy
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Just got this and made my first recipe, i cook often so this was easy to do but if you're not an experienced cook the recipes are simple and it even includes helpful hints and breaks down a lot of techniques. Btw I cooked Roasted Cauliflower with capers and pine nuts pg. 208 (I added Chicken)
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Long prep times but decent recipes
customer_reviews.text: The recipes are delicious but I think the author assumed everyone has access to an industrial/restaurant kitchen when writing the prepare time. Most of the dishes take a long time to prepare. So be wary of that but the dishes I have tried in this book are delicious. Also love the fact that they post all nutrition details for every recipe. If you plan on keeping the book in prestine condition get the spiral back, I had mine for just under 3 months and the pages are already starting to come out (I got the paperback version).
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Get the spiral bound!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cookbook! This is the first cookbook that has stayed on my counter this long. I’ve had the book for a few weeks and I have cooked dinner and most lunches from this book. Some do take a lot of time, but there are fast recipes marked. Using canned beans helps a lot for most recipes. You should definitely get the spiral bound copy, it’s so easy to flip and fold the book, best choice. We are eating so much healthier now and take out is a thing of the past.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great cookbook for fresh food
customer_reviews.text: Love this cookbook! The recipes are not overly crazy, and although the ingredients lists look daunting on some of the recipes, most of the stuff many average people already have in their pantries (or can find easy substitutes). The pictures make me want to just eat everything, so the only drag is that you have to make everything first! But the meals are really easy and the info that goes along with each one is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: ZachT

customer_reviews.title: Hubby loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Which means, I love it, because he dove right in and has already used this cookbook to whip up some amazing, healthy dinners! I went ahead and bought him the more expensive spiral-bound version, and am glad I did - much more user-friendly.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great book for eating the healthy Mediterranean way
customer_reviews.text: Very extensive variety of recipes. Each one detailed with not only with the "how" but also the "why". Covers salads, entree's, desserts and more. Great glossary of terms found in the back. A great addition to our kitchen as my wife and I try to eat healthier.
customer_reviews.author: 18thfairway

customer_reviews.title: Great cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I like this cookbook. There are recipes that I will never use but it has gotten me out of a rut and I am making some different things. Well documented and pics good. Wish I could get some of these dishes out to eat.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Matheny

customer_reviews.title: It’s alright
customer_reviews.text: This cook book has a lot of great recipes. It’s well put together. It includes vibrant dishes and excellent cooking directions. The reason I gave it 3 stars is that a lot of the ingredients are hard to come by in regular grocery stores. I’ve had to go to specialty stores for ingredients for almost all of the recipes I’ve tried. I’ll also add that the recipes can be very expensive. If you are on a budget then this is not the cookbook for you.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Nice cookbook.
customer_reviews.text: I like the cookbook. I dislike that it doesn’t cook for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Comprehensive, Love That It Has Photos & Recipe Variations
customer_reviews.text: This book is great. It really has everything you need (sauces, spice blends, full recipes). I've loved the recipes I've tried so far and appreciate that there are photos. The only thing I'd say is, because of its size and the number of recipes, it's a little difficult to navigate. I would also love to see time and calories for each recipe, though I know that'd make it longer and isn't the ATK's focus.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: BEST Mediterranean Cookbook, ever!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down, the Best Mediterranean Cookbook ever! And, I've had many but, believe me, this is the only one you'll need! Sooo much information...shopping, meal planning, beautiful color pics throughout and delicious, savory recipes. 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Irene Browne

customer_reviews.title: A good mix of cuisines
customer_reviews.text: Have made at least 20 meals from this book and all have been easy and authentic.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Best cookbook ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is my all-time favorite cookbook. Every recipe include a detailed explanation of WHY certain ingredients were chosen, what can be substituted, and cooking tips to make every attempt a success. Was hesitant to buy it as a paperback, but it lays out well, no need to purchase the more expensive 3-ring version. And the calorie/nutrient table at the back is helpful when you're browsing recipes in search of lower sodium, higher protein, etc. meals. Appropriate for both novice cooks and experienced chefs - it's just that good!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to follow recipes in a great format
customer_reviews.text: I debated between purchasing this cookbook and Nancy Harmon Jenkins's The New Mediterraneon Diet Cookbook. I chose this Complete Mediterranean Cookbook and am very pleased. The 500 recipes are easy to follow and I feel suit the American cook. It will be my go-to cookbook going forward. If you are looking for authentic ingredients and recipes, particularly for seafood, I think Nancy Harmon Jenkins's cookbook is superior and I will likely add it to my collection soon. But for an initial transition to Mediterranean cooking, this America's Test Kitchen Mediterranean cookbook cannot be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mediterranean cookbook
customer_reviews.text: This cookbook came quickly. It was packaged pretty well. I do like the spiral-bound it’s easy to read and to follow the recipe. I like the introduction of each section. I do wish it were divided into types of meals such as breakfast lunch and dinner. The contents and the index are very helpful as are the nutritional values of each of the recipes. I would order the book again
customer_reviews.author: redkatgirl

customer_reviews.title: Vibrant and Healthy Recipes
customer_reviews.text: This cookbook covers every aspect of Mediterranean cooking. Flank Steak Peperonata, Pita Bread, Arugula Salad with Pear, Almond, Goat Cheese and Apricots made a delicious dinner, topped off the Honey-Glazed Peaches with Hazelnuts. Those are just a few of the easy-to-prepare dishes. There are lots of photos and ingredients that are available in local grocery stores.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy L. Otto

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes from A.T.K
customer_reviews.text: Dr. suggested trying Mediterranean diet for health issues. Cookbook is full of great ideas. Feeling so much better eating this way. Love the cookbooks by America's Test Kitchen. Learning so much.
customer_reviews.author: GMA

customer_reviews.title: Not crazy about this cookbook
customer_reviews.text: The recipes are not very good. I have read through the entire book tonight and am not really happy with this book. A few recipes I will try.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Not a book for those who don't love cooking
customer_reviews.text: I am pretty disappointed in this book. I love salmon and it's excluded from recipes because it isn't found in the Mediterranean area. The recipes call for numerous spices and ingredients that one probably needs to go to a farmer's market to obtain, which is difficult for us working folk. The one positive is there are many recipes so you may find a few that you can use. If you enjoy experimenting with spices and less common ingredients then this book is for you. If you are a busy person who cooks to live versus loves to cook, then this book is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great book,  excellent recipes but problems with binding
customer_reviews.text: I love the recipes and that they provided reasons for the substitutions that would make some of the recipes not truly authentic and possibly a little easier for the American cook. I would not recommend this to someone looking for easy and quick recipes with ingredients regularly found in your pantry. I will use this for special occasions and adapt the recipes for my family's tastes. The reason for 4 out of 5 states is that my spiral bound edition came with pages 183-222 upside down and I spent an hour undoing and rebounding the book myself which was a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Althea

customer_reviews.title: We've loved everything we've made from this book so far
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book because I enjoy watching America's Test Kitchen on TV! I was also interested in healthy and easy recipes, and this book more than fulfills those needs. The authors share tips, methods, and information that help you understand the Mediterranean diet. Although there aren't pictures to go with every recipe, this is an awesome book!
customer_reviews.author: M. Tan

customer_reviews.title: Great reference book but not well made..
customer_reviews.text: Its a great reference book. Lots of pictures. The downside is that it's not well made and will be torn apart soon. I have replaced it and they all are the same. poorly made. Other than that it's great
customer_reviews.author: SaM

customer_reviews.title: Good Grub!
customer_reviews.text: America's Test Kitchen has never let me down! I have many of their cookbooks and I subscribe to Cook's Illustrated. Hubby and I decided we needed to take better care of ourselves and decided to give The Mediterranean Diet a try. I ordered this cookbook to figure out how to cook the types of foods we needed to eat. I haven't made a recipe yet from this book we haven't really enjoyed. I love ATK!
customer_reviews.author: angie bee

customer_reviews.title: delicious
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful book with great photos. All of the recipes are delicious but many are time consuming and call for ingredients that are hard to come by. As usual, you can't go wrong with America's Test Kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: pat

customer_reviews.title: Like it b/c it not only has many recipes
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this cookbook after my doctor talked about the Mediterranean Diet. Like it b/c it not only has many recipes, from easy to more difficult to prepare, but it thoroughly explains the diet and the products and foods you'll need in your pantry to succeed. Only con, for me, is that there aren't more photos of finished recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Margot C. Wohadlo

customer_reviews.title: Well worth owning !
customer_reviews.text: I agree with other reviewers - this book is well worth owning. Forget internet based recipes - this cookbook provides in depth knowledge on ingredients and preparation; complete listing for calories in back. Each recipe begins with "why this recipe works" and justifies the preparation technique / ingredients chosen beforehand. The end results are consistently delicious and successful By far, the best cookbook in this category.
customer_reviews.author: S.P.

product_meta.title: The Complete Mediterranean Cookbook: 500 Vibrant, Kitchen-Tested Recipes for Living and Eating Well Every Day
